description.narrative: The Africa Strategy and Innovation Fund supports projects and initiatives that further the aims of the Government’s Africa Strategy, which places Ireland’s traditional strong development focus in the broader framework of political, economic and cultural relations with African countries. An updated fund came on stream in 2019 following the Government’s commitment to double Ireland’s global footprint through the Global Ireland policy (2018) and as Ireland’s new policy for international development, ‘A Better World’, and new Government of Ireland Africa Strategy were launched (2019). The Africa Strategy and Innovation Fund supports an enhanced engagement with countries of secondary accreditation in Africa, and supports innovative projects which build Ireland’s profile and leverage existing investments from multilateral and civil society sources. Funding under the Africa Strategy and Innovation Fund must demonstrate value addition and alignment to the goals of the international development policy and to Global Ireland.

The Africa Strategy and Innovation Fund supports the broad objectives of the Government’s Africa Strategy and the Global Ireland policy, which commits to doubling Ireland’s global footprint. It also supports innovative approaches to the implementation of Ireland’s new policy for international development, ‘A Better World’. These policies provide an increased impetus to expand our bilateral relationships, deepen our political engagement, innovate with our development cooperation and continue to seek opportunities for trade and investments in Africa. Increasing trade with countries in Africa, and supporting their inclusive and sustainable economic growth, is a focus of the Africa Strategy and Innovation Fund.
